title: Multicultural Interior Design Project-Based Language and Visual Communication Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, basic communication skills in multicultural environments (reading, writing, listening, speaking), and understanding of specialized design terminology (vocabulary)
context.additional_context: An international practical competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers. Involves constructing collaborative learning environments using digital tools and applying integrated evaluation systems for language and visual elements.

learning_goals: Development of text-based communication skills explaining cultural contexts when applying at least three interior design processes reflecting historical backgrounds of diverse cultures.

Acquisition of design explanation skills combining professional terminology and visual expression when utilizing metric scales and traditional color systems required in international project environments.

Learners will derive three ethical design principles reflecting multicultural social contexts (cultural differences, language barriers, accessibility, etc.), create one design proposal applying them, and achieve at least 4 points (on a 5-point scale) in at least three out of four evaluation criteria (clarity, creativity, cultural appropriateness, technical accuracy) from an expert panel during a 10-minute presentation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
